topics.body:
"@QuasarNova":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/553300606368726da24b0700#post_553300606368726da24b0700
It has more to do with puritanical ideology.

I mean come on think about it for a second; how often does something as simple as new forms of dancing cause social wars.

It's the biggest social flaw in the usa.

Let me tell you a story about usa history: there was a city in early usa (I forgot what city it was) that was a puritan city.  Anyway one day a girl started dancing in the street and told people that she was bit by a spider and that was why she was dancing.  Other people started dancing in the streets claiming that they were bit by the spider as well.  After about a year of everyone in the town dancing things went back to normal.

topics.body:
"@Gizoid101":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/553300e863687228494d0100#post_553300e863687228494d0100
From a legal standpoint porn of it is legal in most places; rather the reason why you don't see it on the web is because a universal campaign by ISP providers to block access and bank companies to block any forms of payment for keeping the sites up.

To put it simply: I don't give a shit about the morals of it cause I don't like that sort of thing and I don't care, *BUT* what it does illustrate is that moral guardians totally 100% have the power to blacklist anything they deem morally offensive from the internet and the people that go "porn will never be blocked; you're just a conspiracy theorist" are fucking higher than a satellite.



Basically I would totally be 100% unsurprised if by 2020 it's almost impossible to gain access to porn sites without proxies to non-american servers.

I don't know US. But I can definetely say porn is very much illegal in these parts, morality and that stuff aside, it's more of the lines of "I don't mind if you have certain sexual conducts, other people don't care or want to see them so keep them in the confinements of your residence"

I know you don't care about morals, but not everything is an attempt at censorship but simply common sense of fucking someone's brains out on public display. I know it doesn't seem, but there's a difference.

topics.body:
"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/553302de63687210cd6e0000#post_553302de63687210cd6e0000
Personally I dont think moral guardians do have that power. Companies however! They do. But I doubt they will bother to do anything unless the money points that way.

Like with Nintendo. Being linked to porn in the eyes of the broad public could hurt sales, so it makes sense theyd attack paheal. Get rid of the problem. Protect the money.
